translation.text: Aasaa, Fifth Mehl, Du-Padas:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: You have been blessed with this human body.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਮਿਲਣ ਕੀ ਇਹ ਤੇਰੀ ਬਰੀਆ ॥

translation.text: This is your chance to meet the Lord of the Universe.

transliteration.text: gōbind milan kī ih tērī barīā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਅਵਰਿ ਕਾਜ ਤੇਰੈ ਕਿਤੈ ਨ ਕਾਮ ॥

translation.text: Other efforts are of no use to you.

transliteration.text: avar kāj tērai kitai n kām .

This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. translation.text: Joining the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, vibrate and meditate on the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||1||

translation.text: Make the effort, and cross over the terrifying world ocean.

text: ਜਨਮੁ ਬ੍ਰਿਥਾ ਜਾਤ ਰੰਗਿ ਮਾਇਆ ਕੈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: This human life is passing away in vain, in the love of Maya. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: janam brithā jāt rang māiā kai .1. rahāu .

text: ਜਪੁ ਤਪੁ ਸੰਜਮੁ ਧਰਮੁ ਨ ਕਮਾਇਆ ॥

translation.text: I have not practiced meditation, penance, self-restraint or righteous living;

transliteration.text: jap tap sanjam dharam n kamāiā .

text: ਸੇਵਾ ਸਾਧ ਨ ਜਾਨਿਆ ਹਰਿ ਰਾਇਆ ॥

translation.text: I have not served the Holy Saints, and I do not know the Lord, my King.

transliteration.text: sēvā sādh n jāniā har rāiā .

translation.text: Says Nanak, my actions are vile and despicable;

translation.text: O Lord, I seek Your Sanctuary - please, preserve my honor. ||2||29||

text: ਤੁਝ ਬਿਨੁ ਅਵਰੁ ਨਾਹੀ ਮੈ ਦੂਜਾ ਤੂੰ ਮੇਰੇ ਮਨ ਮਾਹੀ ॥

translation.text: Without You, there is no other for me; You alone are in my mind.

transliteration.text: tujh bin avar nāhī mai dūjā tūn mērē man māhī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਤੂੰ ਸਾਜਨੁ ਸੰਗੀ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਮੇਰਾ ਕਾਹੇ ਜੀਅ ਡਰਾਹੀ ॥੧॥

translation.text: You are my Friend and Companion, God; why should my soul be afraid? ||1||

transliteration.text: tūn sājan sangī prabh mērā kāhē jī darāhī .1.

text: ਬੈਠਤ ਊਠਤ ਸੋਵਤ ਜਾਗਤ ਵਿਸਰੁ ਨਾਹੀ ਤੂੰ ਸਾਸ ਗਿਰਾਸਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: While sitting down or standing up, while sleeping or waking, with every breath and morsel of food, I never forget You. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: baithat ūthat sōvat jāgat visar nāhī tūn sās girāsā .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਰਾਖੁ ਰਾਖੁ ਸਰਣਿ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਅਪਨੀ ਅਗਨਿ ਸਾਗਰ ਵਿਕਰਾਲਾ ॥

translation.text: Protect me, please protect me, O God; I have come to Your Sanctuary; the ocean of fire is so horrible.

transliteration.text: rākh rākh saran prabh apanī agan sāgar vikarālā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਨਾਨਕ ਕੇ ਸੁਖਦਾਤੇ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਹਮ ਤੁਮਰੇ ਬਾਲ ਗੁਪਾਲਾ ॥੨॥੩੦॥

translation.text: The True Guru is the Giver of peace to Nanak; I am Your child, O Lord of the World. ||2||30||

transliteration.text: nānak kē sukhadātē satigur ham tumarē bāl gupālā .2.30.

text: ਪ੍ਰੀਤਮ ਸਿਉ ਮੇਰੋ ਮਨੁ ਮਾਨਿਆ ਤਾਪੁ ਮੁਆ ਬਿਖੁ ਖਾਇ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: My mind has surrendered to my Beloved; my fever has taken poison and died. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: prītam siu mērō man māniā tāp muā bikh khāi .1. rahāu .

text: ਪਾਲਾ ਤਾਊ ਕਛੂ ਨ ਬਿਆਪੈ ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮ ਗੁਨ ਗਾਇ ॥

translation.text: Cold and heat do not touch me at all, when I sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord.

transliteration.text: pālā tāū kashū n biāpai rām nām gun gāi .

text: ਡਾਕੀ ਕੋ ਚਿਤਿ ਕਛੂ ਨ ਲਾਗੈ ਚਰਨ ਕਮਲ ਸਰਨਾਇ ॥੧॥

translation.text: My consciousness is not affected by the witch, Maya; I take to the Sanctuary of the Lord's Lotus Feet. ||1||

transliteration.text: dākī kō chit kashū n lāgai charan kamal saranāi .1.

text: ਸੰਤ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ਭਏ ਕਿਰਪਾਲਾ ਹੋਏ ਆਪਿ ਸਹਾਇ ॥

translation.text: By the Grace of the Saints, the Lord has shown His Mercy to me; He Himself is my Help and Support.

text: ਗੁਨ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਨਿਤਿ ਗਾਵੈ ਨਾਨਕੁ ਸਹਸਾ ਦੁਖੁ ਮਿਟਾਇ ॥੨॥੩੧॥

translation.text: Nanak ever sings the Praises of the Lord, the treasure of excellence; his doubts and pains are eliminated. ||2||31||

author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: I have found peace, and the seat of pain has been removed. ||1||

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਅਨਦੁ ਭਇਆ ਸਭਿ ਮਿਟੇ ਵਿਸੂਰੇ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: I am in ecstasy, and all of my sorrows have been dispelled. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: anad bhaiā sabh mitē visūrē .1. rahāu .

text: ਓਹੁ ਨ ਬਾਲਾ ਬੂਢਾ ਭਾਈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: But the soul is neither young nor old, O Siblings of Destiny. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: ōh n bālā būdhā bhāī .1. rahāu .

text: ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮ ਨਿਤਿ ਜਪਿ ਮਨ ਮੇਰੇ ॥

translation.text: Chant the Lord's Name each and every day, O my mind.

transliteration.text: rām nām nit jap man mērē .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਸੀਤਲ ਸਾਂਤਿ ਸਦਾ ਸੁਖ ਪਾਵਹਿ ਕਿਲਵਿਖ ਜਾਹਿ ਸਭੇ ਮਨ ਤੇਰੇ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: You shall find lasting peace, contentment and tranquility, and all your sins shall depart. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: sītal sānht sadā sukh pāvah kilavikh jāh sabhē man tērē .1. rahāu .
